alert.note: Alert for Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Plains, or 8 miles west of Americus, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Plains, Sumter, Dumas, Croxton Crossroads and Friendship. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
